jobs_results.title: Regional Sustainability & Net Zero Lead Consultant
jobs_results.description:
Company Description

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realise their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects, in over 110 offices worldwide.

Job Description
• South East Asia
• Full-time
• Department: Advisory

This is an opportunity for real impact and career progression, joining a global professional services company and take a leading role in the South East Asia net-zero carbon transition.

We are a growing team of sustainability consultants that support Turner & Townsend clients across Asia and globally with their transition to low-carbon, sustainable future models. The size of Turner & Townsend offers opportunities to work across a range of projects across Real Estate, Infrastructure and Natural Resources/Renewables.

This role is focused on building our... sustainability capability in South East Asia, with potential to expand across Asia, working closely with Turner & Townsend’s multidisciplinary teams – from our regional hub in Singapore. We are seeking candidates who bring sustainability consultancy capabilities and networks and are excited by the opportunity to build a new team within this growing sector.

As part of our national Sustainability team, you will be supported by our team who run major existing commissions across the Real Estate, Infrastructure and Natural Resources Sector.

Overview of the role

The aim is both to develop a locally-relevant & present service to support Turner & Townsend’s business in region – as well as to support other global Sustainability initiatives as required.

The successful candidates are will need to be able to competently deliver Sustainability and Net Zero/Energy Efficiency consultancy advice as the basis for growing a team. For this you’ll need experience and understanding of some or all of the following subject matter:
• Regional and/or corporate decarbonisation programmes
• Energy efficiency and carbon emissions reductions for existing assets
• Low carbon & sustainable design & certification for new construction
• Strategy/project delivery experience in the built environment
• Programme and project management and leadership

Key outcomes

Working with regional strategic leadership and our existing local teams to develop and deliver a growing pipeline of sustainability consultancy in the region, responding to a significant level of interest from existing clients.

Approximately 50% of your time is expected to be spent delivering consultancy services, with the other 50% work winning and team development, with an aim to grow a team within 12 months.

Typical Consultancy Services

Turner & Townsend’s support for clients extends throughout the full consultancy life-cycle and whichever lifecycle stage may cover diagnostics, strategy, consulting, delivery management, assurance and continuous improvement. We operate across Real Estate, Infrastructure and Natural Resources/Renewables and support both the public and private sectors with their existing assets and new-build capital programmes.

Across the Sustainability Team, and within these growth roles, we wish to build-out our regional capability to support clients with:
• Net Zero programme management
• Net Zero baselining, strategy & action plans
• Energy efficiency & renewables
• Certification – BREEAM, LEED, WELL
• Social value
• Embodied carbon
• City-wide/Regional Energy Accelerator Programmes
• UK/Global client support programmes

Additional services that we would be interested in:
• Waste/circular economy
• Heat networks & smart energy
• Policy & research
• Digital solutions for management and reporting
• Sustainable procurement
• Training & leadership

Qualifications

Candidates should have strong experience and a good applied knowledge of sustainability, energy management and carbon reduction projects, covering a number of the consultancy areas outlined above.

Key background includes
• Public sector (including housing, local, regional and/or central government)
• Private sector (including developers and/or large corporates)
• Team building, management and leadership
• Consultancy and business growth

We have existing consultancy services that could be expanded in social housing, local government and health sector so experience would be particularly advantageous.

Competencies

Essential
• Firm professional grasp of the wider sustainability agenda
• Ability to lead this service regionally, supporting clients and colleagues to understand and maximise sustainability in projects and programmes
• Good understanding of low and zero carbon technologies and strategies to reduce emissions in buildings (e.g. Renewable energy, heat pumps and fabric measures)
• Effective relationship management
• Enthusiasm for growing a team and business in a fast moving environment

Desirable
• Ability to develop and convey strong business cases to support investment in carbon reduction and sustainability
• Structured approaches to environmental management (e.g. ISO14001/EMS/ISO50001)
• Experience in new build or retrofit of buildings (domestic or non-domestic)

#LI-RT1

Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com

jobs_results.title: #sgunitedjobssalesforce Consultant
jobs_results.via: via MNC Jobs Singapore | MNC Jobs In Singapore
jobs_results.description:
Roles and Responsibilities

As a Salesforce Consultant, you will be responsible for gathering requirements, solution and design reviews, integration and data approach, release management methodology, fit/gap analysis of product capabilities, adoption approach, and best practices related to use of the Salesforce.com platform and guidance around adoption of Salesforce functionality.
Key Responsibilities Include
• Proactively work with enterprise customers to improve their adoption roadmap and return on investment.
• Support sales team as a pre-sales consultant.
• Develop Integrations, security and accessibility with complex development requirements.
• Implement and Improve Salesforce DevOps processes in projects.
• Develop training materials and conduct training to customers
• Write configuration documents, prepare technical and functional specification documents, and deliver documentation to be used for future reference.

Required Skills and Experience
• 6+ years of experience... implementing and integrating enterprise systems
• Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering Degree or equivalent experience
• Must be a Certified Salesforce Administrator.
• Certifications as Salesforce Sales/Service/Community/Marketing/Pardot Consultant will be a big plus.
• Ability to define and deliver custom Force.com enterprise applications.
• Strong customer facing experience
• Hands on development experience with Apex, Visualforce and/or the salesforce.com API
• Experience with data extraction, transformation and load tools will be an advantage

jobs_results.title: IT Technology Senior Consultant
jobs_results.description:
Requisition ID: 269580

Work Area: Information Technology

Expected Travel: 0 - 10%

Career Status: Professional

Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve... people’s lives.

SUMMARY

As a member of the Secure Workstation Services Team in Workplace Delivery, you and your fellow colleagues are responsible for delivering, managing and supporting the secure administrative workstation environment across all SAP environments. The team utilizes the latest Windows 10 operating system, Microsoft security toolsets and Microsoft Endpoint Management services to provide next level security for administrators accessing SAP's most critical infrastructure services. As a senior team member, you will be a subject matter expert in one or more topics (Windows OS hardening, supply logistics, Patching, deployment, etc) while supporting the day to day operations during the Asia Pacific time zone.

The ROLE:
• The position requires great analytical and communication skills in combination with a genuine service-oriented approach with the ability to anticipate changes and recommend service improvements
• Workplace Delivery provides the key services and infrastructure to support SAP's digital transformation globally. We are a diverse and global team focused on using the latest technology to deliver extraordinary results.

ROLE REQUIREMENT
• Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines or similar work experience
• Security + certification or equivalent
• Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert or equivalent
• Minimum 5 years experience configuring and delivering Microsoft Windows devices to end users, with recent experience hardening the Windows 10 operating system
• Minimum 5 years experience deploying Microsoft Windows with System Center Configuration Manager or Microsoft Intune (Microsoft Endpoint Manager)
• Powershell, Advanced Level
• Microsoft Windows OS troubleshooting, Expert Level
• Previous experience working in a large organization supporting users across mulitple time zones and countries

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations

jobs_results.title: SOX ITGC Compliance Senior Consultant
jobs_results.description:
Skills:
• Should have worked on consulting/implementation & audit of SOX IT General Controls associated with IT Operations (Mandatory)
• CGEIT, COBiT Experience & COSO ERM execution (preferred)
• Excellent understand & experience in IT applications & infrastructure management which includes SDLC, App Security, DevOps, Networks, Data Centre Operations, Service Management/Service Desk, Server Management etc.
• Excellent understanding of IT Service Management processes. ITIL certified.
• Should be able to identify & report risks related to SOX ITGC design effectiveness & operational effectiveness gaps
• Should have experience in executing end-to-end SOX ITGC audit life cycle
• Exposure to other regulatory compliances such as Data Protection Act
• Candidate should have client facing experience

jobs_results.title: Inhouse Recruitment Consultant
jobs_results.description:
Our client specialising in contact centre. Due a major expansion program, is seeking an Inhouse Recruiter to join its team. This role will allow you to have the experience of working for a major corporation which is also your client.
Responsiblities

• Recruitment and selection; job advertisements, shortlist and arrange interviews
• Prepare manpower reports and liaise with respective division on their manpower needs
• Coordinate recruitment activities e.g. career fair
• Prepare contracts/letters of employment for new hire

Requirements
• A minimum of 1 year experience in recruitment preferably in mass recruiting
• Ability to conduct face to face interview would be an added advantage
• Candidate with CEI certification will be an added advantage
Interested applicant please send your resume to recruit1@tbs.com.sg. We thank you for your application but only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Woon Yun Shia(Fion Karis)
Transcendent Business Services Pte Ltd
EA:R1110743/10C5505

jobs_results.title: Functional Consultant – Microsoft Dynamics ERP – Finance
jobs_results.company_name: HITACHI SOLUTIONS ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
jobs_results.description:
JOB OBJECTIVES

To be able to provide full cycle implementation, consulting, configuration, training, installation and support for clients using Microsoft Dynamics ERP. It is expected that the Functional Consultant has deep knowledge of GL, AP, AR, FA and Bank Management experience and exposure to other modules such as Inventory, Supply Chain, Project Accounting.

Job Responsibilities
• Work through client teams across different business units to gather requirements and communicate effectively.
• Configure Microsoft Dynamics ERP Financial Modules based on the requirements
• Advise customer organization on solution usage and help minimize gaps between standard product customer's business processes with creative configuration.
• Prepare Business Process Discovery Requirements and functional specification for customizations required
• Work with Management Reporter 2012 and configure reports
• Demonstrate Microsoft Dynamics ERP in Conference Room Pilots
• Understand multiple enterprise... systems, their high level functions and put together process flows, gap analysis, and create business mapping.
• Test the functions and the features being developed and confirm that they fulfil the business requirements.
• Plan and perform data migration using DIXF into Microsoft Dynamics ERP
• Prepare User Manuals and deliver training to end users
• Provide pre-go live and post go live end user support.
• Other duties as deemed necessary for the job.

Job Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree
• CPA or Cost Accounting certification is highly desired
• Microsoft Dynamics AX certification and/or experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations, AX 2012 R2, R3 or AX 7/D365FO are a plus
• At least two years’ experience in ERP implementation, configuration, system design or related business experience
• Experience in configuring General Ledger, Bank Management, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Fixed Assets, Management Reporter is required
• Experience in Expense Management, Multi-company, Project Accounting, Trade and Logistics is a plus.
• Knowledge on Localization Requirements / Financial Policies and Procedures is a Plus
Proficient with Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Word.
• Excellent writing and verbal skills
• Locally-based candidates are preferred

Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

We always have great success in matching the best candidate with the job openings. Our DELIVERIES: Quality Speed Technology Right Pricing User eXperience Our CORE VALUES: Integrity System Consistency Forward Looking Humanity, and Environmental Friendly Junior / Senior Business Analyst Job Title: Junior / Senior Business Analyst Work Location: Central Singapore Job Type: 3 Years Contract, subject to renewal About the Job Primary Responsibilities: Elicit, scope and manage the... Agency’s business requirements Develop the business case and Tender Specifications Evaluate and recommend ICT solutions that best address the needs Prioritise product backlog through rigorous information gathering and analysis with stakeholders, and contribute to the development of the Functional/ Design specifications Review testing and data conversion documents to verify that specifications are met Drive smooth deployment, adoption and operations of the solution analyse impact of requested changes (Operations & Maintenance phase) Work with developers to understand and troubleshoot technical problems, as needed (Operations & Maintenance phase) Job Requirements: Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information/Infocomm Technology, Computer or Electronics Engineering or related discipline Minimum 3 years of working experience for Consultant and 5 years of working experience for Senior Consultant Participated in full software or product development cycles, preferably using Agile Methodology with past development experience Proven experience in IT business analysis, application solutioning and design, and testing Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem-solving skills Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders Advantageous to have Consulting or Business Analysis experience Business Analysis certification (Certification of Competency in Business AnalysisTM (CCBA®), Certified Business Analysis ProfessionalTM (CBAP®)). Knowledge of, or experience in implementing projects in at least one of the following areas (Data Analytics, Agile Methodologies, Internet and Mobile Technologies, Customer Relationship Management, Knowledge Management, Service Design, Cloud Solutioning. Locals preferred (SPRs are welcome to apply). What’s in it for you? It’s important each and every employee feels they are supported and can complete their life’s best work today and in the future. We are investing in each person not only with competitive compensation, but also with industry benefits and perks. A few ways we support our employees is by offering: Competitive Salary H&S Insurance Coverage Annual Leave and Medical Benefits Company events and annual awards (subject to Covid-19 situation) Community and sustainability support Other benefits The key objective of this role: To deliver an Awesome User Experience through result-oriented outcomes with friendly service disposition call it Thatz Way!
